pages.title: Tastes
pages.text: {b Tastes} are a set of numeric dimensions describing the properties of a beverage. The Tastes of a beverage are closely associated with the {(beverages_basics/sways)Sways} it would have.

pages.title: Semi-Tastes
pages.text: The value of a Taste can range from negative to positive, and the (+) values and (-) values are given different names ({b Semi-Tastes}).
For example, {sw Sweetness} is a Taste. When the value of {sw Sweetness} of a beverage is (-), the beverage is {sw savory}; when (+), the beverage is {sw sweet}.

pages.title: Changing Tastes
pages.text: A beverage with no (solid) ingredients has all its Taste values be at zero. Adding an ingredient into the {(mechanisms/whisk)whisk} typically changes one or some of the Tastes, with the changed Tastes and the intensity depending on the ingredient itself.

For example, the description of a melon slice item (by default) reads {sw Sweetness II}, meaning that if you add a melon slice into a beverage, the beverage becomes two points {sw sweeter}; or you can also say that it is two points less {sw savory}.
Currently, there are five Taste dimensions, as listed below.

pages.name: Sweet & Savor
pages.pos: {sw Sweetness}. The precipitated sunlight; from time to time, mead and lead.
pages.neg: {sw Savoriness}. The consolidated sea breeze; from time to time, blood and curd.

pages.name: Astringent & Smooth
pages.pos: {as Astringency}. That is tongue-wrinkling; as if licking a fuzzy vine.
pages.neg: {as Smoothness}. Absence of, or neutralizing astringency.

pages.name: Pungent & Bland
pages.pos: {pu Pungency}. The lightless and flameless fire contained by herbs and spices.
pages.neg: {pu Blandness}. Absence of, or neutralizing pungency.

pages.name: Thick & Thin
pages.pos: {th Thickness}. That not only bewaters, but also sates.
pages.neg: {th Thinness}. That is only effective to satiate thirst.

pages.name: Soothing & Rousing
pages.pos: {so Soothingness}. That ceases the tumult of souls.
pages.neg: {so Rousingness}. That make the affections surge and the winter nights less harsh.
